message: Thanks for joining today. To get us started, could you walk me through your background and how it led you into marketing and sales?

Of course. I started in a more traditional sales role at Rivermark ReadyMix, where I handled client management and CRM alongside cross-functional teams. That grounded me in relationship-building and negotiation. While finishing my degree, I transitioned into retail planning and now into a more end-to-end marketing and sales role with Luna & Co., where I manage everything from merchandise planning to product promotion and sourcing.
You've worked across sales, inventory accuracy, and now online retail. How do those experiences come together in your current role?

They complement each other well. My inventory and planning experience helps me make data-backed decisions, while my sales background ensures those decisions stay customer-focused. In my current role, I balance demand planning, supplier coordination, and promotional strategy with quality control, so nothing operates in isolation.
Tell me about a recent win or result you're particularly proud of in your current position.

Recently, I streamlined our product sourcing and QC process, which reduced fulfillment issues and improved customer feedback. At the same time, I supported targeted promotions that helped move slower inventory without heavy discounting. It was a good example of aligning operations with marketing goals.
